SYN_PT_1_8: The patient was intubated for a bronchoscopy to investigate suspicious lung nodules. We inspected the airways and found no visible tumors. Using the navigational catheter, we steered to the right lower lobe nodule. The radial ultrasound probe confirmed we were centrally located within the lesion. We proceeded to take samples using a needle, forceps, and a brush. The pathologist in the room confirmed cancer cells were present. The patient woke up well.
